skill.name: example-skill
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user asks to "demonstrate skills", "show skill format", "create a skill template", or discusses skill development patterns. Provides a reference template for creating Claude Code plugin skills.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when the user asks to "demonstrate skills", "show skill format", "create a...
skill.author: anthropics

security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure documentation template containing no executable code. All 15 static findings are false positives: markdown code block syntax was misidentified as shell command execution, and documentation metadata was incorrectly flagged as cryptographic algorithms. No security risks present.

content.value_statement: This skill provides a reference template for creating Claude Code plugin skills. It demonstrates the required file structure, frontmatter options, and documentation guidelines needed to build well-formed skills.
actual_capabilities: Shows the required SKILL.md file structure and frontmatter options
Demonstrates proper description patterns for skill activation
Provides file organization patterns for complex skills
Lists skill content guidelines and best practices
limitations: This is a reference template only, not an executable skill
Does not provide functional code or automation capabilities
Requires users to adapt the template for their specific use case

use_cases.title: Build new plugin skills
use_cases.description: Use as a starting template when creating new skills for the Claude Code plugin ecosystem.

use_cases.title: Document skill structure
use_cases.description: Learn proper file organization and metadata conventions for well-formed skill documentation.

use_cases.title: Contribute to plugins
use_cases.description: Follow established patterns when adding new skills to existing or new plugins.

prompt_templates.title: Create new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a new Claude Code skill called [skill-name] for [purpose]. Show me the proper template structure to use.

prompt_templates.title: Understand skill format
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the required files and structure for a Claude Code plugin skill. What goes in SKILL.md?

prompt_templates.title: Write descriptions
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write an effective description field for my skill that activates when users ask about [topic].

prompt_templates.title: Organize complex skills
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a skill with multiple reference files and examples. Show me the recommended directory structure.

output_examples.input: Show me how to create a skill for processing JSON files
output: Include frontmatter with name, description, and version
Write a description that activates for JSON-related requests
Add optional README.md for additional documentation
Include examples/ and references/ subdirectories as needed

best_practices: Keep skill descriptions specific with exact trigger phrases users will use
Include all relevant keywords and topic areas in the description field
Organize supporting materials in subdirectories for complex skills
Test skill activation with sample queries before publishing
anti_patterns: Using vague or overly broad skill descriptions that trigger too frequently
Overlapping trigger conditions with existing skills
Omitting the required name and description fields from frontmatter

faq.question: What files are required for a skill?
faq.answer: Every skill requires at minimum a SKILL.md file with name and description in the frontmatter.

faq.question: What does the description field do?
faq.answer: The description tells Claude when to invoke the skill based on user queries and trigger phrases.

faq.question: Can I add executable code to a skill?
faq.answer: Skills provide contextual guidance. Executable code should be in separate scripts referenced by the skill.

faq.question: How do I organize complex skills?
faq.answer: Use subdirectories like examples/, references/, and scripts/ to organize supporting materials.

faq.question: What frontmatter fields are supported?
faq.answer: Supported fields include name, description, version, license, icon, author, and category.

faq.question: How do I avoid skill conflicts?
faq.answer: Write specific trigger conditions and test that skills activate only for intended queries.
